China's massive property bubble creates mad scramble to take on decades of debt

Massive infusions of cash by way of the central bank, combined with runaway mass panic-buying has stampeded
reference_text:
Chinese people into buying into the property markets in boomtowns like Shenzhen, despite the insane prices that almost guarantee that they will default on their mortgages -- because they fear that rising property prices will shut them out forever if they don't buy now, and the new rentiers who've speculated on all that property are cranking up rents so fast that renting is worse than buying.

It's an eerie echo of the runup to the subprime collapse of 2007/8, a blend of toxic debt and panic-buying fueled by the fear of literally not having a roof over your head and the belief that property markets can only ever go up because no one remembers the last time they cratered.


In May last year, after the value of his first flat, a 70 square metre unit in Guangzhou's Panyu subdistrict, soared from 900,000 yuan (US$136,500) to 1.2 million yuan in just a few months, Mai,

generated_result.0:
China's real estate market to its lowest level since the mid 1990s and pushed it into a vicious crash.

It all came crashing down in the end on Sunday night with the government announcing another 30% increase in bank reserve requirements, or RMB9.8tn (Rs19.8tn; £11.2bn) for 2017. This was followed by a further devaluation on Monday of the currency which devalues by a factor of about 20 over the course of the day.

This has been the biggest policy shock in Chinese history and is likely to be the last in the history of the PBOC. With the currency devaluation China is likely to have to slash a massive amount of investment in real estate.

While the yuan has lost 40% of its value in the past year, with the central bank now telling banks to pump $200bn more into the market, real estate has fallen by about 10%. That is just enough to push some parts of th
generated_result.1:
Chinese investors into buying at a record-breaking pace.

China's property sector has seen the most frenetic growth in nearly two decades and the property bubble is expanding at a dizzying pace that is putting massive pressure on household income.

The situation has seen prices in many Chinese cities increase by up to 300 percent over the past decade, according to the Hurun Report, a leading research agency.

China's economy is the world's fastest growing, and house prices have risen by a mammoth 400 percent since the end of 2008 and are set to do so for years to come, according to the UBS-S&P Global Property Index.

China's financial system continues to be heavily regulated by the government but in an unprecedented move, the central bank had a 50-basis-point drop in the money supply on July 2, sparking the sharp spike in house prices.

As a result, Chinese buyers have rushed in to purchase the properties in a frenzy,
generated_result.2:
Chinese home investors into what is perhaps the biggest house-price bubble in history.

After a record run-up in property prices last year, China now has the largest housing bubble in the world, according to a report by the Economist Intelligence Unit, a London-based research group.

The real estate index has ballooned from more than $5tn to more than $9.7tn in less than two years.

But it is not just the Chinese that are seeing prices soar: overseas investors are doing so as well, creating a wild scramble to take on decades of debt.

"In many countries, a house is a big loan. In China, it is bigger than a mortgage," said David Yang, chief Asia economist at Barclays. "The government is doing everything it can to rein in the market."

China is currently grappling with the worst housing crisis since the 2008 financial crisis, when house prices started to slide after a five-year real estate boom

prefix_text: The Normans, from the Old Norse for 'north men,' were the descendants of indigenous Scandinavian seafaring pirates and traders called Vikings, who colonized the northwestern part of France in the early 9th
reference_text:
century AD.

They ruled the region known today as Normandy until the midpoint of the 13th century. The most illustrious of the Normans, William the Conqueror, invaded England in 1066. William vanquished the resident Anglo-Saxons; after William the Conqueror, several kings of England, including Richard the Lionheart, Henry I, and Henry II were of Norman blood and ruled both England and Normandy.

Following is a list of the rulers of Normandy, some of whom, in addition to ruling Normandy, also reigned over England.

Rollo, the Walker, 860-932, ruled the Norman duchy from 911-928, he married Gisla, the daughter of Charles the Simple.

William Longsword reigned from 928-942.

Richard I, the Fearless, born 933, ruled Normandy from 942-996, married Hugh the Great's daughter, Emma.

Richard II

century. They ruled for 500 years from the fall of the Roman Empire through the late 12th century, establishing large settlements in Brittany and other parts of France. They did not have a single language but spoke a variety of dialects.

This history is important to the development of the French language and culture. But because the Normans did not speak a single language, they didn't develop any single word-oriented grammar. They used other words such as 'worrier,' meaning'swarthy man,''merci' meaning 'dough,' and 'loup' meaning 'carpenter.'

In this article, I describe how the Normans used a 'linguistic mutation' to create a 'language of numbers,' meaning that words from English, German, French and other languages were lost or replaced by words like 'loup' and 'planchette' that were borrowed from Old French. I also describe how this new language, called Old French,

century A.D.

At the time, the region, which is today known as France, had a population of fewer than 400,000, according to the Oxford University Press.

The Normans had an enormous influence on French society for centuries, establishing the law code, establishing a secular monarchy, establishing a religious hierarchy and spreading Christianity to nearly all of Europe.

The Normans were also among the many European peoples who settled in the Americas and who became the first Europeans to learn the Spanish language and write it down.

reference_text:
TV that eight days after visiting her local salon, where she had her hair washed for 10 minutes, she felt weakness in her left arm and leg. A week later, she had a massive stroke. "They didn't think I was going to live," she recalled.

The stroke left Smith with strength, balance, and vision issues, as well as a brain clot that could kill her if it moves. Smith is now suing the salon, saying they didn't adequately support her neck during the treatment, leading to her stroke.

While it sounds far-fetched, experts say this is a legitimate condition known as beauty parlor stroke syndrome.

"This is a potential problem that we've seen as the cause of strokes, usually in younger people," says Peter Gloviczki, M.D., a vascular surgeon at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. beauty parlor stroke syndrome is caused when there is an injury, tear, or blood clot in one of the

prefix_text: A Los Angeles jury awarded a woman a $417 million verdict yesterday. The jury found that Johnson & Johnson failed to adequately warn users of the cancer risks of the talc in its baby powder.
reference_text:
The jury's 9-3 vote to hold J&J liable for not warning Eva Echeverria about cancer risks is a huge blow to the company, which is facing thousands of such claims across the country. The verdict consists of $70 million in compensatory damages and $347 million in punitive damages, according to Reuters.

No clear link connects talcum powder to ovarian cancer. Some case-control studies, based on asking women who have ovarian cancer about their history, have found a slightly increased risk. But as the American Cancer Society notes, those kinds of studies can be biased because they rely on a person's memory of talc use years after the fact.

Two prospective cohort studies, which don't suffer from that type of hindsight bias, found no increased risk.

It is plausible, scientists say, that talcum powder applied to the genitals could travel through the vagina and into the ovaries, causing inflammation. Since inflammation increases the risk of cancer, it

The BPA-laden talc also was used in baby food products. Johnson & Johnson said it uses chemical dyes to bind talc to the ingredients in baby food. But the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency says the use of such chemicals to bind talc is safe in food products for the environment and human health.

A large majority of Americans – including gun owners – continue to support stronger policies to prevent gun violence than are present in current federal and most state law, according to a new national public opinion survey conducted by researchers with the Johns Hopkins Center for Gun Policy and Research at the Bloomberg School of Public Health.

The survey is a follow-up to one conducted by the same researchers in early 2013, shortly after the shooting at the Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut that left 26 dead.

The results are published online in Preventive Medicine.

"Two years after the tragedy in Newtown, our study of public support for two dozen specific gun policies found a large majority of Americans continue to favor a range of gun-safety policies," says lead study author Colleen Barry, PhD, MPP, an associate professor at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. Sixty percent (60%) of the public, including 83% of gun owners, say it is important for Americans to protect people who should not have guns and should be prohibited from owning them.

This view is nearly universal across all party lines; however, it is particularly strong among Democrats (81%), independents (75%), young adults (73%), and women (68%).

prefix_text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Israel has made an initial request for its annual U.S. defence aid to increase to as much as $5 billion (£3.25 billion) when its current aid package
reference_text:
, worth an average $3 billion a year, expires in 2017, U.S. congressional sources said on Wednesday.

An Israeli soldier directs a tank during an exercise in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, near the ceasefire line between Israel and Syria, August 21, 2015. REUTERS/Baz Ratner

Israel wants $5 billion per year in military aid for 10 years, for a total of $50 billion, the congressional aides said. It has been signalling that it wants more money to counter threats it says will arise as a result of the international agreement on Iran's nuclear programme, which Israel's government has staunchly opposed.

Congressional and other U.S. officials cautioned that negotiations on the new aid deal were still in the early stages and the proposal is not yet at the stage where it has been formally brought to Congress, which must approve the funds.

"First they have to negotiate with the White House," one senior congressional aide said of Israel

generated_result.0:

A Palestinian boy looks on as flames and thick black smoke rise from a building as Israeli police shoot tear gas and water cannon to disperse Palestinian supporters of Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, during clashes near the Old City of Jerusalem October 29, 2013. REUTERS/Ammar Awad

The move by the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) comes as world powers on Wednesday decide whether to renew the Israeli-Palestinian peace process with an election in May.

"We are very interested in the amount and type of assistance that the U.S. Congress will give us... to help offset the increase in our military spending," the Israeli army in a statement said.

Israel was in the second year of a three-year military budget boost of about 2.2 percent, but a deal reached in June that saw it freeze its budget amounted to only about a third of what was

U.S. President Barack Obama and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu exchange smiles during a bilateral meeting at the White House in Washington, January 23, 2016. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque

But Obama's administration has resisted Israel's request for more funds, said the Israeli officials, who spoke on condition of anonymity, including to discuss a sensitive matter.

Obama's administration is wary of the possibility of Israel seeking more funds than it gets under the current deal that runs through the end of the current fiscal year on Sept. 30.

The White House confirmed the offer, which was made to the Israeli prime minister and Defense Minister Avigdor Lieberman, but did not say when it would be made public.

The Israeli proposal would include some changes to a long-term funding formula agreed in the 1980s
generated_result.2:
ends on December 31, Defence Minister Moshe Yaalon said on Wednesday, in a sign of continued American interest in Israel's security.

Israeli soldiers from the Golani brigade guard the road connecting Israel to the West Bank Jerusalem January 17, 2014. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun

In a rare gesture, Israeli defense officials told Israel's Channel 2 television they had made the request with a view to doubling the aid for the current military budget, but did not elaborate on the nature of the proposal.

Israel's $3.3 billion annual aid package is the largest in the world, with only France and Britain getting more.

The U.S. ambassador to Israel, Dan Shapiro, said last year he would like to increase aid to Israel, but with concerns it would cause friction with Washington over settlements in the occupied West Bank.

prefix_text:
In retrospect, it seems obvious that John Stumpf wouldn't keep his job.

The Wells Fargo CEO retired yesterday (Oct. 12), capping a brutal five weeks that began with the
reference_text:
revelation that thousands of the bank's employees were misusing customer information to open accounts they never asked for. The fallout included two punishing hearings before Congress and an embarrassing report indicating the fraud started as early as 2005.

Whether Stumpf jumped or was pushed out by the board, it now seems clear the company is eager to turn the page, just in time for its third-quarter earnings release, which is scheduled for Oct. 14.

But it wasn't long ago that Stumpf appeared safe. He was chairman of the board, he had the backing of investors including Warren Buffett, and significantly, he delivered a 68% total return to shareholders over the course of his tenure—not bad considering he was steering Wells Fargo through the financial crisis or the aftermath for most of the nine years he led the company. And he wasn't just another banking chief, he was 2015's CEO of the Year, according to Morningstar (which might now be having some second thoughts).

generated_result.0:
disclosure that a Wells Fargo subsidiary had created fake accounts for some customers, a huge amount of money at the time.

The company also agreed to pay a $185 million fine over claims that it "misled" customers about the use of free checking accounts for illegal purposes.

"In light of the charges, I made the decision to retire from the bank," Stumpf said in a statement issued by the bank.

Stumpf said he will serve as an adviser to Wells Fargo's board, where he has served since 2012. His compensation package is not directly tied to his time at the bank, but it is expected to rise dramatically.

The bank posted $4.25 billion in quarterly profit, an improvement over the $2.85 billion that the company reported in the prior quarter but still a large drop.

The company has also lost about $1.8 billion over the last year.

Stumpf has faced a barrage of criticism
generated_result.1:
revelation that his former Chief Financial Officer used the company's personal credit card for personal expenses and then covered up the transaction with false representations, reports CBS News correspondent Chip Reid.

"He got caught," Reid said from New York. "It was all public, he was found out, he resigned."

Wells Fargo had initially fired the CFO in late September. And the scandal is only just beginning. The bank has also come under fire from a congressional oversight subcommittee, which recently threatened to hold a hearing to get answers as to why its employees failed to notice and report on such transactions.

The bank said it couldn't discuss the matter due to a court injunction. "We believe the evidence we have at the present stage shows that our employees did not have the appropriate training to comply with the law in the context of these types of matters," the bank said.

In a statement, the Committee on Ethics said: "The Committee takes seriously its responsibility to oversee potential conflicts
generated_result.2:
firing of thousands of bank employees in a financial crisis he knew nothing about.

He had already shown himself to be a poor leader and stockholder after a "gambling incident" in July. He had even given a speech calling for bank employees to resign, not as a group, but individually. Stumpf was even going to call a bank meeting.

At one point he even said he wouldn't resign until the scandal was over.

"The culture of this business and the culture of Wall Street generally is we expect more from people than we expect from people we trust to be our bosses," Stumpf told the media this week.

Instead, he let the scandal fester. He blamed the crisis on bad investments by investors and said that "the American people are the biggest losers" if the economy imploded.

It's likely that Stumpf will remain as CEO of Wells Fargo. Some believe that his replacement, Carrie Tolstedt, shoul

prefix_text: November 25, Santa Monica, CA. – The world's first blockchain-based cross-game marketplace DMarket and the first decentralized Esports and gaming recruitment and management platform DreamTeam have signed a partnership agreement
reference_text:
.

"We have huge experience in gaming and Esports and a shared vision of how this partnership will benefit the global gaming community," said Volodymyr Panchenko, CEO and Founder of DMarket.

According to the agreement, the companies will cooperate on big data analytics and machine learning tools. In addition, DMarket will get 30% of ad space on DreamTeam for 12 months after the launch and will be promoted within the DreamTeam community. The cross-promotion benefits are also provided by DMarket to DreamTeam.

As a part of agreement, DreamTeam will sponsor 72 additional hours of DMarket's Token crowdsale. The crowdsale will now run through December 1 and will be supported by a special offer: all DMarket presale contributors will receive a 15% extra bonus on the DreamTeam Token sale Phase #1, and all DMarket crowdsale contributors will get a 7% bonus during the DreamTeam Token sale Phase #1.

DreamTeam

DreamTeam is a decentralized Esports and gaming recruitment and management platform focusing on attracting high-quality professionals to the Los Angeles-based startup.

The two companies will launch a joint venture to launch an eSports-related online services platform to connect gamers from different online platforms and provide support. The service is expected to be used by companies and professional organizations in gaming, eSports, and gaming culture.

The joint venture will facilitate a new marketplace platform by focusing on a core product: a DMarket. It will provide users with an easy way to connect with gaming, eSports, and gaming enthusiasts all over the world.

The partnership marks the official end of DreamTeam's venture to grow its customer base and accelerate its growth by expanding their digital talent through DMarket. DreamTeam has been in touch with their customers and they are excited by

to develop a new platform, DMarket. Both platforms support the cross-game marketplace model.

"The future of esports is decentralized," stated Andreas Antonopoulos, co-founder of DreamTeam and one of the pioneers of the "decentralized Esports movement," at the launch of DMarket. "The new platform will allow players and coaches to directly link to each other using the DMarket network. This will enable the transfer of all data and intelligence from the esports ecosystem to DreamTeam and make it easy for players and coaches to collaborate on a level playing field."

reference_text:
months.


Mokhtar Hoshmand, a Kurdish activist in Iranian Kurdistan (Rojhelat) told Rudaw that most of the young Kurds who joined ISIS are from the cities of Kermanshah, Jiwanro and Bawajan.


Hoshmand believes that the number of recruits increased following the start of coalition airstrikes against the radical group in Iraq and Syria.


ISIS members have boasted on Facebook pages that the member of Iranian Kurdish volunteers has dramatically increased.


One ISIS Facebook post recently said that in October alone 23 Kurds from Iran had joined the group.


"And nine of them immediately signed up for suicide missions," read the post.


"According to my information, so far 20 Iranian Kurdish members of ISIS have been killed and 30 have been injured," said Hoshmand, who has been researching Salafism and extremist groups for years.

prefix_text: The Ride for Homes is a four-day bike ride that supports Habitat for Humanity Philadelphia. Riders raise critical funds for Habitat's homebuilding projects and bike through Pennsylvania's gorgeous countryside. The tour
reference_text:
is unique because it maintains a small, friendly, supportive atmosphere, and it's fully supported. Over the course of four days, the Ride creates a unique community among participants, raises awareness about the critical need for affordable housing and helps generate funds to keep Habitat for Humanity Philadelphia building and repairing. Register today!

Sponsorship

Each year, generous sponsors support the ride costs and help ensure that every dollar our riders raise goes directly towards Habitat's homebuilding and home repair projects. For more information about sponsorship, please contact Christine Serwan at christines@habitatphiladelphia.org.

Fundraising

We ask each rider to raise $1200 prior to the ride. The dollars your raise go directly to Habitat's construction projects and family programming, and to cover the costs of the trip (housing and support team). The trip is intentionally mission-focused, and to that end we've planned basic but comfortable lodging. This means that you'll be able to have

generated_result.0:
starts at 6:15 a.m. each day at the Penn North Bicycle Garden. The following day, the ride is completed by 3 p.m. Each rider is given a ride bag with money to make donations at the end of the ride. The ride is a non-competitive effort in a non-competitive environment. All riders must be 17 and over.

Click here to RSVP to Ride for Homes

Tours begin with a morning bike ride from the Penn North Bicycle Garden in the City of Philadelphia. On days 2 and 4, ride through the countryside to reach Habitat for Humanity's homebuilding projects, which include homes and a community garden. After completing a three-hour bike ride, riders will attend a social gathering at the Penn North Bicycle Garden. The social gathering features cooking, music and fun activities for riders and participants of the ride. Riders who donate $5 each will receive one of 12 raffle tickets. Riders who donate $7 each can receive tw

begins on Sept. 27 and goes on to Pennsylvania's 12 poorest counties.

The Ride for Homes starts at 10 a.m. on Thursday in Scranton, passes through Chester and Reading, then takes the final two miles to Montgomery to begin. Riders will have the chance to donate and ride the ride, so be sure to share the Facebook event page if you plan to ride.

The Ride for Homes is for all ages, regardless of fitness level, and includes an optional donation to Habitat for Humanity for the cost of an entire day. The proceeds from the ride and donation will go towards Habitat's work in the Philadelphia area. For more information, visit HabitatForHomes.org.

prefix_text:
Just because a used car is cheap and seems OK during a test drive doesn't mean it's safe to buy.

Criminals have devised ways to artfully conceal structural damage on used cars
reference_text:
, allowing vehicles to be sold for a profit even though they may have been shoddily rebuilt after an accident or submerged in ocean water during a hurricane.

When insurance companies write off a vehicle as a "total loss" after an accident or other event like a flood or hail storm, the law in most states requires the vehicle's title of ownership to be given a "brand." That brand permanently marks the car as damaged goods to all potential future owners, but there are ways for it to be washed away. In the old days, it was done with chemicals. Now, photo editing software and digital scanners are used to print new titles. Or, cars can simply be re-registered in different states until the brand falls away.

Because there is no national titling law, incongruous state laws create opportunities for scammers to "title wash" wrecked cars, making them appear undamaged. Not only are consumers being ripped off, but they're also putting themselves and

generated_result.0:
. And some experts say that these tricks may even help an unsuspecting buyer cheat on his insurance premiums by under-reporting damage.

I've spent hours of my life toiling over virtual cities in Maxis' Sim City series, and it must have rubbed off after all these years. I still enjoy meticulously planning infrastructure
reference_text:
, zoning and carefully tweaking finances to this day.

The other day whilst trying to work, I accidentally (oops) went looking for some online heirs to the Sim City throne. Despite simple Flash games MUO Games - The Best Websites to Play Flash Games MUO Games - The Best Websites to Play Flash Games Read More lacking the depth of even the original Sim City, I guessed there had to be a few decent, free city building games out there.

A simple turn-based Flash game created by New Zealand energy company Genesis Energy to give players young and old a shot at managing a town or city's growth and impact. Players must pay close attention to the levels of energy used, sustainability and environmental factors.

Players are given 151 turns to alter tax rates, build things, destroy things and generally oversee the planning of a city from an environmental point of view. It is up to you to keep your citizens happy, maintain finances and get the highest score possible out of

generated_result.0:
to keep my city's infrastructure (like the power grids, road network, and water plants) in order. But it's also fun to play a game designed around the idea of a town's infrastructure. The first time I played the city-building Sim City 2000 I was struck by how little I knew about it. I'd only played some of the online game and that was as a spectator, not a player. I started in a city with a population of four hundred and didn't realise how easy it is to start a city with only a small population.

City-building games aren't just about making sure the world looks like something from a fantasy movie. They have to also play with the concept of city size. In city-building games, there's an economic element, but it's not the only one; the size of a city also dictates the amount of pollution it can absorb and create.

Advertisement

I had played Sim City 2000 in a very small tow
generated_result.1:
and making sure everyone gets their share of the wealth I've spent decades on building. But in recent years I've seen a change. I now realize that those cities have a greater purpose, rather than just the money it's making for Maxis. They're a testament to the importance of community and a promise to our children that we will be more than the sum of our parts.

I've started to see in these virtual cities the same ideas that I've seen throughout my career: that they are a reminder to us that we can be something more than we are. That in fact we have the potential to change the world for the better. As long as we remember the power of community and we live our lives in its light, we'll be okay.
generated_result.2:
such as electricity and water supplies, but I find the simulation's complexity refreshing.

Maxis is a real estate company with a unique brand of entertainment, and its newest addition feels like a healthy step in the right direction. The Sim City 6 demo was a very brief taste of what's to come, but this demo is an ideal test for whether the company has come to the right place.

Advertisement

Sim City 6 will be released on June 9 for Windows PC and Mac.

Six federal bureaucrats were drafted to pose as new Canadians for a citizenship reaffirmation ceremony broadcast on the Sun News network, an event requested by Immigration Minister Jason Kenney's office.

The bureaucrats smiled
reference_text:
and held Canadian flags as the TV hosts referred to a group of 10 people as "new Canadians" that had "finally" received their citizenship.

Mr. Kenney's office apologized on the air to Sun News on Thursday morning, placing the blame squarely on the shoulders of bureaucrats at Citizenship and Immigration Canada.

Story continues below advertisement

Sun News host Pat Bolland said the fact some of the people he presented in the studio last October were not actually new Canadians was "completely unknown to us."

"It would seem that both of us have a little egg on our face," Mr. Bolland said to Mr. Kenney's spokeswoman Candice Malcolm.

Documents released to The Canadian Press under access-to-information legislation show that just a few weeks before Canada's Citizenship Week last October, Mr. Kenney's staff directed departmental officials to add a last-minute citizenship ceremony at the network to their list of scheduled events.

If the App Store app on your iOS device is getting slower or not showing app updates correctly, a new trick can help, courtesy of Zachary Drayer.

To refresh your App Store app
reference_text:
's cache, tap on any of the tab bar items 10 times. The choices are: Favorites, Top Charts, Explore, Search, or Updates.

Keep in mind: You must tap on the same item 10 times for the cache to clear. When it does, the app screen will go blank for a few seconds before resetting.

@steipete tap on any of the tab bar items 10 times. — zachary drayer ✌ (@zadr) December 29, 2015

As saniul later confirmed, this fix also works in the native Watch and iTunes apps too, which is great to know.

If you come across iOS tips that you think would benefit other AppAdvice readers, let us know. You can find us on Twitter @appadvice.

We thank Drayer for bringing this fix some attention on Twitter.

For more news, see: Apple is expected to work on its own virtual reality products

prefix_text: Members of the armed forces are not immune to the substance use problems that affect the rest of society. Although illicit drug use is lower among U.S. military personnel than among civilians, heavy alcohol and
reference_text:
tobacco use, and especially prescription drug abuse, are much more prevalent and are on the rise.

The stresses of deployment during wartime and the unique culture of the military account for some of these differences. Zero-tolerance policies and stigma pose difficulties in identifying and treating substance use problems in military personnel, as does lack of confidentiality that deters many who need treatment from seeking it.

Those with multiple deployments and combat exposure are at greatest risk of developing substance use problems. They are more apt to engage in new-onset heavy weekly drinking and binge drinking, to suffer alcohol- and other drug-related problems, and to have greater prescribed use of behavioral health medications. They are also more likely to start smoking or relapse to smoking.

Illicit and Prescription Drugs

According to the 2008 Department of Defense (DoD) Survey of Health Related Behaviors among Active Duty Military Personnel, just 2.3 percent of military personnel were past-month users of an illicit drug

generated_result.0:
tobacco use among servicemen have been identified by some as a key reason for the high rate of alcoholism among members of the Armed Forces.2

Some experts have suggested that excessive alcohol consumption among military personnel should be considered a significant risk factor for alcohol-related disorders, perhaps even an additional risk factor (for further discussion of the relationship between alcohol and psychiatric disorders, see section on Drug Addiction.) Alcohol abuse is associated with a range of negative social and economic outcomes in the form of poorer socioeconomic status and higher health care costs.3–7 These associations have also been associated with more frequent mental health diagnoses in both civilians and military personnel.8–10 The higher incidence of mental disorders in U.S. military personnel may also reflect other factors, such as a military-centric culture.11

Despite such evidence, it remains unclear how military members might overcome such associations. Studies of servicemen in the United States and in the military in the United Kingdom have shown that military veterans are not more likely

cocaine use is a real problem. Alcohol and drug use are the most common causes of injury, suicide, accidents and other causes of disability that affect military personnel. In 2001, the military accounted for 2.2 percent of all alcohol-related injuries and 0.8 percent of all injuries involving drugs. The annual military rate of alcohol-related injuries and accidents has increased 40 percent over the past five years.1 While the prevalence of alcohol problems in the military is much lower than in the civilian community, some military commanders worry that their ranks have a high number of alcohol-dependent veterans.2,3

While U.S. military drug policies are quite strict (see Section II.B.1.b), most military service members who use illicit drugs don't face any formal disciplinary action.1 The primary reason for this is that many U.S. military members engage in "zero tolerance" policies, which call for no marijuana, cocaine, heroin, or other substance use on or
generated_result.2:

The use of alcohol among U.S. military personnel is a leading cause of injury and death among the service members on active duty. During fiscal year 2002, alcohol-related injuries and deaths caused by alcohol use were 3,981 per month (approximately $34,750), of which alcohol-related deaths accounted for 3,941 (2.3 percent). After Brooks Orp
reference_text:
ik left the game in the second period, his Capitals teammate, Dmitry Orlov, was lucky to skate away from what could have been a catastrophic hit by Pierre-Edouard Bellemare.

Bellemare was given a major and game misconduct. He saw Orlov's numbers the entire way and there's a good chance we've seen the last of the Flyers forward, which could be only one more game after Washington went on to win 6-1 and take a 3-0 series lead.

Flyers fans didn't react too well and threw wristbands that were handed out pre-game on the ice causing officials to issue a warning, which meant if it happened again a penalty would be assessed. The Wells Fargo Center PA announcer pleaded with fans to stop.

Of course, Alex Ovechkin would score on the ensuing power play and the fans resumed tossing the bracelets, causing a delay of game penalty on the Flyers.

The annual Sapporo Snow Festival kicked off today in Japan. The center piece is an enormous Star Wars snow sculpture that looks like the Empire's take on Mount Rushmore.

According to IT Media and Game Watch, the Star Wars snow sculpture measures 15 meters tall, 22.6 meters across, and 20 meters deep.

Taking around a month to complete, the snow sculpture was built from seven-hundred 5-ton-trucks' worth of snow. That's a lot of snow—in fact, it's the most snow ever used for a snow sculpture at this festival.

As someone who's gotten a lot of tattoos, I'm familiar with the feelings of being constantly "touched." It's a feeling that I also have, and one that I'm now starting to experience with my new "tattoo-ish" tresses. But before I knew it, I knew the pain of getting new tattoos, and now I can help.

As a woman who's worked with people to alter their bodies to become tattooed, I often see the same pattern in my clients. They have to first work with a doctor to make sure that they don't have diseases that make it difficult to get the required amount of ink to create a body tattoo. They'll then get a body scanner to find the right amount of ink, and then another body scanner to find out the right location of the tattoo. Then they'll get the appropriate tattooing machine to create the tattoo on their body.

The Apache Foundation has added a new machine learning project to its roster, Apache PredictionIO, an open-sourced version of a project originally devised by a subsidiary of Salesforce.

What Prediction
reference_text:
IO does for machine learning and Spark

Apache PredictionIO is built atop Spark and Hadoop, and serves Spark-powered predictions from data using customizable templates for common tasks. Apps send data to PredictionIO's event server to train a model, then query the engine for predictions based on the model.

Spark, MLlib, HBase, Spray, and and Elasticsearch all come bundled with PredictionIO, and Apache offers supported SDKs for working in Java, PHP, Python, and Ruby. Data can be stored in a variety of back ends: JDBC, Elasticsearch, HBase, HDFS, and their local file systems are all supported out of the box. Back ends are pluggable, so a developer can create a custom back-end connector.

How PredictionIO templates make it easier to serve predictions from Spark

PredictionIO's most notable advantage is its template system for creating machine learning engines. Templates reduce the heavy lifting needed to

generated_result.0:
IO does is it takes the data you input and provides you a list of probable outcomes. Predictive analytics are more difficult to perform than simply assigning a value to a variable like height or weight, as they require the input of a great deal of information, a lot of which can't be represented in a text file.

This leads to a great many problems for those of us using text files to store data, as this is the perfect place for hackers to manipulate the data with malicious intent.

To that end, the PredictionIO project is comprised of a Python package that leverages existing text file parsers, a library to manage them in a distributed fashion and a machine learning platform. In short, it's a set of tools for taking raw data, analyzing it with machine learning software and providing you with a list of likely outcomes based on that information.

According to an announcement, the algorithm is called DQ-RNN, designed by the University of Toronto's Yann LeCun, and it was designed to detect patterns in big data without needing a massive amount of knowledge of the underlying data. HAVEN >> A woman who was driving under the influence of alcohol when her car struck and killed a Bethany teenager on Christmas night 2015 has avoided prison time.

Barbara Ann Ross of Cheshire, who was 60 at the time, struck Robert Weidig Jr., 18, on Route 69 in Bethany as he walked with a friend to a Christmas music-and-dance event.

Ross was charged with illegally operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol and failure to drive in the proper lane. She pleaded no contest to the first charge.

Superior Court Judge Melanie Cradle imposed a sentence of six months, execution suspended, and eight months of probation on the first charge. The second charge was nolled.

reference_text:

The "Hafiz" program, which pays unemployed Saudis 2,000 riyals ($533) a month for up to one year, was announced by King Abdullah during the Arab uprisings last spring and introduced in late 2011.

"The number of beneficiaries this month rose by 40 percent from last month and by 170 percent from December when the program started to pay the monthly subsidy," said the official Saudi Press Agency, quoting Khaled al-Ajmi, the Labor Ministry official in charge of Hafiz.

Thanks to a decades-long population boom, the Saudi government can no longer afford to reduce unemployment by creating public sector jobs. Last year's revolutions in Egypt, Tunisia, Libya, Yemen and Syria were blamed by some on high youth unemployment.

prefix_text: The Ontario government is likening a proposed Christian law school's requirement of no sexual intimacy outside of heterosexual marriage to a bar against Jews that existed in the province's legal profession nearly 200 years ago.
reference_text:
Ontario says it has insisted that access to the profession be open to all, beginning in 1833, when it abolished a requirement that effectively barred non-Christian lawyers through an insistence on receiving the Sacrament of the Lord's Supper, a Christian ritual. In 1892, Clara Brett Martin became the province's first female lawyer, with the support of the Attorney-General.

"Ontarians have a right to expect that they or their children can seek to become lawyers without facing impediments because of their religion, gender or sexual orientation," the province says in a written filing with the Supreme Court.

prefix_text: Crataegus, commonly known as Flowering Hawthorn trees, are popular for their spring flowers in shades of white, pink and red and the autumn berries. Hawthorn trees are beneficial to wildlife
reference_text:
, useful for tough or exposed positions and can be used on boundaries as a deterrent.

Hawthorn trees are of great benefit to British wildlife, with the thorny foliage providing a protected zone. Mature Hawthorn trees can support more than 300 types of insects. Their fruits are eaten by birds, such as thrushes and waxwings (who disperse the seeds in their droppings) and small mammals. The white flowers provide a good source of nectar for bees.

Crataegus is a large genus of shrubs and trees well suited to planting as ornamental trees, street trees and garden hedging. The common Crataegus monogyna has white flowers as do a number of other varieties, but there are also red and pink flowering Hawthorn trees. Haw refers to the fruit but it is actually the Old English name for hedge. It is a common misunderstanding that the phrase: 'Ne'ver cast a clout till May is out' means do not shed

generated_result.0:
and can be the target for a wide range of invasive species. The species can become invasive through a lack of care of any kind on the part of owners or carers.

There are three species of Hawthorn in New Zealand.

Hedgehorns are native to New Zealand, although populations have been reintroduced into the wild. There are no restrictions on their use.

Swarthy hawksbill, also known as white-throated hawksbill or green-banded hawksbill, are native to New Zealand and occur in open-air locations.

Hawthorn beetles are not native to New Zealand but they can become a pest in gardens.

Habitats

Most Hawthorn trees are herbaceous evergreen trees which grow over the ground. They are often found in grassy areas along roadsides, rivers and other lowland areas.

Hawthorn trees form dense stands with low, tightly wound trunks,
generated_result.1:
and are excellent shade trees in cities or rural areas. They are also well known to help with the control of aphids, mites, ticks and other pests.

The plant is native to the United States of America, Canada, Mexico, Central and South America and Europe. It originated in South America during the Late Jurassic period and is very common in South America. This plant has been cultivated throughout Europe for many centuries and is thought to be indigenous to Asia.

Benefit

Hybrid seedlings are excellent for landscaping and planting as mulch for areas of land that cannot be reached by traditional seedlings. They will provide shade and have a very attractive foliage. They are well suited for the landscape as they have a pleasant, bright shade zone and a relatively narrow trunk that can be used to reach soil areas.

Stalk

Hybrid seeds are planted in clusters and tend to be quite long with clusters growing up to 10 feet (30 m) in heigh
generated_result.2:
throughout the year.

Wildlife is protected under CSCA (Canada) and MNRV (Mississauga, Ontario, Canada) and they are listed in the MNRV Red List of Threatened Species.

Hawthorn trees are highly-desirable and it is important that we protect our native plants, especially at the root level in order to have a healthy forest environment. The red leafing Hawthorn trees have excellent winter survival and they can be found in every forest in North America. They do not reproduce at other times of the year.

Harvesting and Planting Hawthorn

Harvesting a Hawthorn tree is easy and is accomplished by first cutting the tree. This helps to reduce its damage. The first cutting should be to remove all the leaves. To remove a mature branch, hold the cutting in a downward pressure and remove it with a straight blade. The tree will drop down slowly and carefully to the soil level.

prefix_text: When I worked as a scout for the Carolina Panthers in the mid-2000s, then-coach John Fox would break up the season into quarters and set a goal to achieve a 3-1
reference_text:
record in each to ensure a playoff berth.

While it's probably surprising to hear losses factored into a year-long equation, Fox had the perspective to understand that a 12-4 mark would get any team into the postseason. In fact, he frequently suggested that hitting our marks at each checkpoint also would put us in prime position to secure home-field advantage as the top seed in the conference.

Of course, there are a variety of factors that contribute to achieving such goals, but Fox would focus on winning the division, owning our home field (finishing with a home mark of 7-1 or better) and knocking off the top teams in the other divisions. He believed the confidence gained from defeating the heavyweights in the league would pay huge dividends in the playoffs.

To prepare for some of the challenges on the schedule, Fox routinely would have the team face the schemes of unfamiliar opponents during the offseason. Since we were in the NFC South, we were extremely familiar

generated_result.0:
record in that time period. After an offseason of trying to make a few big runs, he would have me write out a play call for each game. Police have arrested two men allegedly involved in a double shooting in Chinatown early Saturday morning.

One woman was killed and a man was critically injured.

The shooting took place inside Cuties Cafe
reference_text:
at 36 N. King Street just before 2 a.m.

Police said two men attempted to rob the establishment before the shots rang out.

Benjamin Baniaga, who lives nearby, says he was asleep when he heard the loud noises. "I heard choke commotion really loud, I heard something break then a guy saying 'Hey, let go!'"

Paramedics arrived on scene around 2:30 a.m. and treated 44-year-old Tara Tevaga of Halawa with a gunshot wound to her chest. She was transported to a nearby hospital, where she later died.

Police say a 25-year-old man was also shot in the shoulder. He was taken to the hospital in serious condition and is expected to survive.

Shortly after the shooting, police say they were able to locate and arrest 29-year-old Dane Salanoa for investigation of robbery. He was later released pending investigation,

A

generated_result.0:
located near Broadway and South Third Street in Chinatown.

The victim was found outside the Cuties, which was open at the time of the shooting. The victim was transported to a local hospital in critical condition.

Detectives are continuing their investigation and detectives from the Los Angeles Police Department's Gang Enforcement Team, as well as detectives from the Los Angeles Police Department's Homicide Bureau, responded to the scene.

Detectives are working to determine if the suspect's vehicle was involved in the shooting. The suspect was not arrested.

Anyone with information about the shooting can call the LAPD at 213-996-1800, Silent Witness at 888-877-5273 or the Homicide Bureau's TTY Line at 213-786-6347.

prefix_text: Biological invasions are not only events with substantial environmental and socioeconomic impacts but are also interesting natural experiments, allowing the study of phenomena such as the cultural evolution of bird song following introduction. We took an
reference_text: excellent opportunity to compare the distribution of dialects of the yellowhammer Emberiza citrinella, a small Eurasian passerine, in its native source region (Great Britain) and invaded range (New Zealand) more than hundred years after relocation. Recent field recordings (including those provided by volunteers within a citizen science project) were complemented by those from archives, each assigned to appropriate dialect by visual inspection of a sonogram, and the resulting spatial patterns of dialect distribution were interpreted using historical data on the yellowhammer invasion. The two countries differ markedly in the composition and distribution of dialects. New Zealand populations sing a greater number of different dialects, seven in total, five of which were not detected in the current British population, but have been reported by previous studies from the continental Europe. Two identified localities of capture (Brighton, Sussex, UK) and release (Dunedin, Otago, NZ) differ even more strikingly, having no dialects in common. The largely sedentary nature

prefix_text: Last month, we reported that Windows 10 grew by almost one percentage point - according to NetMarketShare's data - to claim 27.63% of the market. Although the increase isn't as major
reference_text:
this month, it's still quite significant in terms of indicating the trend in OS market share.

According to the latest statistics provided by the aforementioned firm, Windows 10 has now grown to 27.99%, while Windows 7 has fallen to 48.43%. Although these changes may appear to be slight and within the margin of error, they do continue to follow the trend set in the past few months.

Click to enlarge | Image via NetMarketShare

Similarly, Windows 8.1 usage decreased to 6.07% from the 6.48% reported last month. Windows XP also faced a slight decline and now commands the same market share as Windows 8.1. Apple's macOS grew very slightly and now sits at 3.59%. The "Others" category, which also includes Linux distros, increased to 7.84%.

Click to enlarge | Image via StatCounter

A separate firm, StatCounter, indicated similar trends as well. All iterations of the Windows

prefix_text: Several major civil-rights organizations, including the NAACP and the ACLU, are expressing outrage that President-elect Donald Trump has picked Alabama Sen. Jeff Sessions to be the next attorney general of the United States
reference_text:
.

A statement from the NAACP Legal Defense Fund blasted Sessions' "decades-long record—from his early days as a prosecutor to his present role as a senator—of opposing civil rights and equality." President and Director-Counsel Sherrilyn Ifill wrote, "It is unimaginable that he could be entrusted to serve as the chief law-enforcement officer for this nation's civil-rights laws. This is yet another signal from the incoming administration that it is not only prepared to turn its back on equality; it is actively working to continue to sow division and undo decades of progress."

The selection followed a meeting between Trump and Sessions on Wednesday, in which Trump said he was "unbelievably impressed" with Sessions. The senator, to say the least, is a controversial choice to run the Justice Department, as he has been publicly accused of racially charged comments and actions as far back as the 1980s.

"The last person women and families need in this

generated_result.0:
.

"We cannot defend the indefensible," says NAACP President Cornell William Brooks, adding that the Trump administration would be a "danger to our community and to our country." Brooks says Sessions' nomination demonstrates how "we are returning to the dark days of racial division. And it is a threat to our values."

The NAACP is the third major civil-rights group to denounce Sessions. The NAACP's decision to take up the issue came after Trump appointed Stephen Bannon, a white nationalist who heads a populist political movement, as chief strategist and senior counselor in the White House.

President Barack Obama nominated Sessions for the U.S. district court for the Southern District of Alabama in 1988 after he was dismissed by federal judges for violating the U.S. Constitution's antiracist laws. The Alabama Supreme Court threw out the decision. Sessions had also had a long record of racist comments and had been the chief prosecutor in Sessions' Alabama county during the height of the civil-rights era

"While Sessions' positions may reflect his ideology as a former federal prosecutor, it is our assessment that this nomination is highly damaging to communities of color, particularly Latinos."

prefix_text: London (CNN) Buckingham Palace has complained to Britain's press watchdog after a tabloid newspaper published an article suggesting Queen Elizabeth II was in favor of the UK leaving the European Union in a forthcoming referendum.
reference_text:
A palace spokeswoman said a complaint had been made with the Independent Press Standards Organization over Wednesday's front-page article in The Sun headlined, "Queen backs Brexit."

The complaint related to Clause 1 of the Editors' Code of Practice, which applies to issues of accuracy, the spokeswoman said.

Earlier Wednesday, the palace issued a statement insisting the Queen was neutral on whether the UK should vote to leave the EU -- a development widely referred to in the press as a "Brexit," or "British exit."

The UK will have a national referendum June 23 to vote on whether to leave or stay in the 28-member bloc.

Britain is a constitutional monarchy in which the royal family is seen as above the political fray.

Palace: Queen'remains politically neutral'

Citing an unnamed "senior political source," The Sun said that at a 2011 lunch at Windsor Castle, the Queen told Nick Clegg, then the deputy prime minister, that

generated_result.0:
The palace made the complaint in a letter dated Thursday, the Sunday Telegraph reported Thursday evening.

"While we are aware that the newspaper has published a front-page article on Wednesday in which there is a reference to the Queen's support for the UK leaving the EU, we would like to draw your attention to the fact that we have made our own concerns known to the Press Complaints Commission," a royal official wrote, according to the Telegraph.

Queen Elizabeth II is not allowed to speak publicly on any referendum.

Britain, France and Italy are holding their own referendums later in the month on whether to stay in the European Union. A majority of the population has said they want to remain.

The Royal Household said on Friday that "a small percentage of our staff" have been concerned by the article but did not detail the specific reasons for the complaint.

Office for Nuclear Regulation approves design for new reactor at Horizon Nuclear Power's plant at Wylfa, Anglesey

Plans for a major new nuclear power station in Wales have taken a crucial
reference_text:
step forward as UK regulators approved the project.

The Office for Nuclear Regulation and two other government bodies gave the green light on Thursday for the Japanese reactor design for Horizon Nuclear Power's plant at Wylfa, marking the end of a five-year regulatory process.

Duncan Hawthorne, Horizon's chief executive, said: "This is a huge milestone for Horizon and a major leap forward for us in bringing much-needed new nuclear power to the UK."

Attention will now turn to financing the Hitachi-backed project on the island of Anglesey, which was the site of Britain's oldest nuclear plant until it closed two years ago.

During a visit by UK ministers to Japan last December, it emerged that London and Tokyo were considering public financing for Wylfa. This would be a significant break with the UK government's previous approach.

Hooters History

The 1990s

1991

In the growing Hooters tradition of seizing opportunities, HOA President, Bob Brooks, spotted the un-sponsored up-and-coming
reference_text:
owner/driver Alan Kulwicki. The two cut a deal for the last NASCAR race of 1991 in Atlanta. That great exposure blossomed into a full sponsorship the following year, which resulted in the little underdog nicknamed "Mighty Mouse" winning the prestigious Winston Cup at the Hooters 500 on the very track where it all started. His reverse victory lap became a signature.

1993

On April 1, 1993 – ten years to the day of Hooters first incorporation – tragedy struck. While on a promotional trip carrying the Hooters colors, fan-favorite Kulwicki, along with Mark Brooks, Dan Duncan and Charlie Campbell, all perished when their plane crashed outside of Bristol, Tennessee. The system mourned its champions but came back with greater resolve to honor their memory.

1995

In 1995, Hooters of America Chairman Robert Brooks, who lost his son Mark in the crash, decided to jump into late model, short track racing and established the USA Hooters Cup

Hooters started out with one location, but soon grew to become the "Franchise of the Century" as the largest chain of fast food restaurants in the USA. A major contributor to Hooters' growth was its location at the Houston Astrodome. Its success with the Astrodome led to expansion to other stadiums throughout the country. To further establish the success of the restaurant in the Houston area, the city's Chamber of Commerce and the Harris County Parks Department gave the franchise to the city of Houston as their official corporate entity. Rod McGuirk, The Associated Press


CANBERRA, Australia - Australian lawmakers committed on Wednesday to legalize the growing of marijuana for medical use within a part of the world renowned for zero-t
reference_text:
olerance and harsh penalties for illegal drugs.

The government introduced a bill to Parliament that would amend the Narcotics Drugs Act 1967 and create a licensing scheme for growing medicinal cannabis. Marijuana is currently illegal throughout Australia, but two states are considering making the drug available for therapeutic uses.

"This government understands that there are some Australians suffering from severe conditions for which cannabis may have applications and we want to enable access to the most effective medical treatments available," Health Minister Sussan Ley told Parliament.

The bill is guaranteed to become law, with the main opposition party immediately pledging support.

Southeast Asia has some of the world's toughest drug laws.

Indonesia, Australia's nearest neighbour after Papua New Guinea, created a diplomatic rift last year by rejecting Australian pleas to spare the lives of two Australian heroin traffickers. The Australians were among eight drug convicts executed by firing squad in April. Indonesia argued that the tough response was needed because narcotics abuse among Indonesians had reached

generated_result.0:
lerance drug laws.

The conservative Liberal Party passed the bill by a margin of 98 votes to 37 in the upper house, the lower house of parliament. Lawmakers also passed a similar medical marijuana bill this year.

The proposal, dubbed the Therapeutic Use of Marijuana Act, was passed despite an opposition rebellion from the Greens, who called for it to be tabled as an amendment to a broader bill already in the House of Representatives to legalize possession of small amounts of recreational marijuana.

Supporters of medical marijuana said the measure is based on medical evidence, and that legalizing cannabis could also curb the criminal abuses associated with pot use.

"Medical marijuana is about making sure people with debilitating disease can safely use cannabis for treatment so that people don't end up addicted," said Bill O'Neill, the Liberal Party's medical marijuana spokesman.

The vote for medical marijuana passed mostly because of a push by a small group of Greens who opposed the bill as a way to push

A parliamentary inquiry called for public hearings on the potential for medical marijuana, including research into the possible benefits, but it did not specifically call for a federal law.

It was the first time an elected government had said it wanted to consider the use of medicinal cannabis. Prime Minister Tony Abbott said in an interview with ABC television that the "potential is there."

The Lib Dems could once wield the power of kingmakers in a hung parliament. Now that role has been usurped by the Scottish Nationalists. The party is overtaken in the polls by Ukip, and in some places by the Greens. It has never been easy to define the concept of "liberal democracy" in Britain. Now it is unnecessary. There is competition even for the "dustbin" vote, and from parties with targeted causes.

Clegg's performance in the 2010 election debate was so dazzling that he was lauded as second in popularity only to Churchill. I wrote unkindly that this was as good as it was going to get. By Sato. April 10, 2017. 5:00am

Person
reference_text:
a 5 celebrated the series' biggest launch with 1.5 million in global shipments last week, and the game also helped Atlus take their very first No. 1 debut in the UK software charts.

Persona 5 Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Wildlands LEGO Worlds Grand Theft Auto V Mass Effect: Andromeda FIFA 17 The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Lego City Undercover Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare Overwatch

As you can see, Persona 5 managed to snag the top spot in the midst of some stiff competition. What makes it an impressive feat is not only did it manage to help Atlus get its first #1 in the UK charts, but this makes it the first JRPG to take the top spot in the UK after Ni no Kuni back in 2013 for PlayStation 3.

Final Fantasy XV came close, but no cigar, as it placed #2 behind the massively popular FIFA 17. The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, while not exactly a

generated_result.0:
a 5's success this past week in Japan has helped Atlus' latest title on the Nintendo Switch, Persona 5, take its first #1 spot in the UK software charts this week.

The Persona 5 PS4 version has sold more than 13.5 million units and sold over 7 million copies worldwide since it launched in Japan last year. It's been the top-selling title for the last three weeks with the title currently sitting at #2.

Persona 5 is currently available for both PlayStation 4 and PS Vita, and Atlus has already stated that the console version will also be available as a PlayStation TV exclusive in the future.

Persona 5 will launch for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 3 in North America and Europe on June 14th, 2017, and in North America and Europe on August 4th, 2017, and Australia and New Zealand on September 15th.

Source: Twitter via Siliconera

a 5 held the top spot in the worldwide software charts for the second week in a row, and the new PlayStation 4 game held the #1 spot in Japan, the publisher announced.

Persona 5 launched in Japan on March 3 and Europe on March 8. The game has already reached 1 million copies sold since its release in Japan, and it is currently the top-selling PlayStation 4 title in that market.

The PS4 launch is the biggest of the year for Atlus, which is best known for its RPG series Persona. The game is also the top-selling game for the PS4, and its combined sales are now over 5 million copies.

She suffered dog bites all over her body and succumbed to injuries while on her way to hospital. The dogs also attacked the local people who tried to rescue the woman by chasing them away. "Some of these minors were held under

The so-called administrative detention is a manner of imprisonment without trial or charge that allows the Tel Aviv regime to incarcerate Palestinians for up to six months. The detention order can be renewed for indefinite periods.

The committee's director, Issa Qaraqe, stressed that the released figures show a spike in such detentions since 2015 in the occupied territories and East Jerusalem al-Quds.

"Palestinian children were subjected to torture and abuse inside the Israeli jails," he said.

He further called on international organizations to "protect Palestinian children from detention." "This requires a wide and fast action from the international community," he added.

Canada needs to scrap the capital gains tax and slash corporate taxes as a way to enhance economic growth, Conservative leadership hopeful Maxime Bernier said Tuesday.

In a speech to a business audience,
reference_text:
the Quebec MP outlined what he called an ambitious plan to unleash Canada's productive forces even as he thumped familiar Conservative tropes.

"Prosperity does not come from government spending but rather from entrepreneurs' investing," Bernier told receptive members of the Canadian Club.

Overview

docs tests package

Ways is a pipeline tool for Python that helps users write code to be more flexible to change. It was originally designed as a basic asset management system (AMS
reference_text:
) for file paths but now can mix with file paths, databases, and third party APIs, all at once.

Ways links projects together so that, if a change needs to happen for multiple projects at once, it can be done concisely, in one place, without the need to re-deploy.

Free software: MIT license

Installation

pip install ways

Documentation

The main documentation can be found here:

https://ways.readthedocs.io/

In particular, two good pages for newcomers are https://ways.readthedocs.io/en/latest/summary.html and https://ways.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html

Example

The main idea is to make it easier to write high-performance, high-concurrency code that is also easy to read and maintain. It gives users the ability to write code that can run in parallel with one or more parallel threads. It's an excellent tool that helps you to focus your coding effort on writing the most powerful, high-concurrency code. It is designed for programmers who can make good use of the resources provided by the Python language.

The official documentation is maintained at docs/docs.py. Some additional details of the tool, and the motivation behind making it possible, can be found in the man page.

See examples of how it can be used in practice in the Examples directory.

In particular, it can be used to write simple code that can be evaluated with your favourite IDE in an easily portable way.

Documentation

Examples

Example:

>>> import docs >>> docs.test('hello world') Hello World

The above will print out a short, simple example program.

If your code was written using the docs.Test() class, it will be given a simple list of 'hello world' examples.

Contributing

You can write any code you want within the examples folder. However, you are free to provide any additional docs or documentation you want in that folder as well.

When should we be alarmed about so much wealth in so few hands?

The Great Recession and its anemic recovery only deepened the economic inequality that's drawn so much attention in its wake.
reference_text:
Nearly all wealth and income gains since then have flowed to the top one-tenth of America's richest 1 percent.

The very wealthiest 400 Americans command dizzying fortunes. Their combined net worth, as catalogued in the 2015 Forbes 400 list, is $2.34 trillion. You can't make this list unless you're worth a cool $1.7 billion.

"America's skewed wealth is one of the most critical issues of our time."

These 400 rich people — including Bill Gates, Donald Trump, Oprah Winfrey, and heirs to the Wal-Mart fortune — have roughly as much wealth as the bottom 61 percent of the population, or over 190 million people added together, according to a new report I co-authored.

That equals the wealth of the nation's entire African-American population, plus a third of the Latino population combined.

A few of those 400 individuals are generous philanthropists. But extreme inequality of this sort undermines social mobility

The story of the economic recovery is a story about class warfare — a story about how a few big winners dominated our economy after the 2007 crash and the Great Recession. And yet for most Americans, the recovery has left us with much less wealth.

The average household in the U.S. saw its income decline to about $55,000 last year from $64,000 in 2008 — a decline of just a fraction of 1 percentage point. In many ways, the country is in the midst of the worst recession since the Great Depression — and yet despite having been forced to make tough choices and endure a painful downturn, most Americans continue to feel like the winners. The Great Recession's impact

As a nation, we have lost more than 10 million jobs since the end of the recession in 2009. That's three-fourths of the growth we lost. If we were living in an entirely different decade—say, 1970—the jobs losses would be even more severe.

Our economy has been hit so hard by the Great Recession, that our median income has shrunk by over 5%. That's not good. A growing economy requires decent wages, good working conditions, and enough good jobs for decent wages to go around. If we don't raise the minimum wage, many workers will have to struggle even harder.

The wealth accumulated in the hands of a small minority of people is much more worrisome.

By Emma S

In late 2014, to help a friend, I joined the team of Wander, the non-combat, exploration MMO, volunteering to help with mundane things like filling out paperwork and
reference_text:
maybe playing the game a little to check out a few features. Nothing serious, I thought. I didn't know that I'd soon be called in to help more often, to be company during work periods that would run late into the night, to be the in-house tester for the game, and to manage its growing player community.

I also didn't know, then, that Wander would soon (and I hoped briefly) be made notorious by players calling it "the worst game on PS4 ever."

I don't have a background in game development or even public relations, but I am a gamer. I have a long history of playing MMOs, from World of Warcraft to really obscure Korean MMORPGs, and I'm not bad with a sniper rifle in an FPS. But at the time Wander launched, after spending six years at university on multiple science degrees, I was looking to embark on a PhD or medical school. A lot of the other team members weren

generated_result.0:
coordinating schedules.

Wander was a game, designed for friends and family, built on a community of people who had come together to build an amazing game.

The thing I wanted to do, though, was something that I never thought of doing before.

I wanted to make a game about loneliness.

The concept of a lonely game has been around for a while. But it's been largely relegated to indie game development, despite strong support from gaming's industry leaders.

There was a Kickstarter campaign I helped raise awareness around in 2014, and a few smaller indie campaigns followed. But while these games were both unique and wonderful, both were designed around social interaction.

I wanted to create a game where everyone was the hero, and the character you chose was the player character. That meant we needed to make a game that was very player-driven.

The first step was to get the game up and running. With a tiny budget, I s

I found the job really enjoyable, but I didn't realize how much of an advantage it was until I was running a company of two and a half hundred people, with hundreds of developers, who was mostly new.

prefix_text: As a kid, I played a game called The Sims, a life simulation game in which you create virtual people called Sims and help them satisfy their desires. Each Sim had its own set of meters for
reference_text:
energy, appetite, hygiene and several more needs. A meter I found particularly interesting was comfort.

Not unlike humans, Sims got moody when they stood up for a while or faced prolonged discomfort. For maximum happiness, they needed luxurious chairs, a comfortable bed and an expensive bathtub.

We tend to apply a similar logic to our own pursuit of happiness. As we grow, we invest lots of time and money creating a comfortable living space, assuming that, like Sims, added comfort will provide us higher well-being. But how wise of an investment is this?

Comfort as a drug

Have you ever noticed how quickly you get used to new "toys"? Whether it's a next-gen phone or a cozy couch, things lose their freshness rapidly. The satisfying buzz they provide doesn't last, because our brain gets accustomed and ends up taking them for granted.

It is common knowledge that relying on drugs for happiness is an ineffective strategy;

generated_result.0: happiness and arousal, along with some of their own routines and skills. The system allowed me to define them in many different ways and even let me change their personalities in ways I'd never imagined. So my Sim was a happy and energetic teenager, who had a great sense of humor, and who kept busy by working hard to maintain the illusion of normalcy. But in the game, I never met the Sims that I'd created in my own imagination. And in the first place, that didn't bother me as long as they were just "mapped" by the game in their own ways. But I was not satisfied. I wanted to meet them, and my quest began to unfold. My Sim's life was not the real Sim's life in any way. And I couldn't stand the idea of being the only one, the only one with the sim, all alone and lonely with no one to share the Sim's life with. Eventually, I realized I had to go somewhere—any
generated_result.1:

If there's one thing that sticks out from The Sims to modern gamers, it's the social interaction among its citizens, and how, during their idle time, they can work off their stress and anger or feel good about themselves in the process. There are some basic social structures that have always existed in humans that make sense to today's games, and we've tried to figure out why we don't have those in the Simian world that would provide this sort of social interaction. We'll see if the sims are able to develop those structures.

In terms of the design of their characters, they're basically human but we've never seen them interact with one another in that way before. I can't say what their relationships are but they're not just sims — this isn't the Sims. They are beings who are human. They have their
generated_result.2:
happiness, relationships, and all sorts of other variables — a big part of the fun was imagining those relationships. The Sims was a game with no fixed, objective goals. Players could "spend money," or, better, spend it on Sims. Or Sims could be "loved."

I did some online research on my own, and while no one I could find had any idea what a "love" meter was, the internet has led me to many a website that claims to have one for real, although none of them seemed to really have anything useful. Eventually I decided to find out for myself.

You might be able to find some information on the web about how to calculate love points. For example, you can calculate a "love" percentage, which indicates how much your Sim is happy with you. New Street Station has been at the centre of public attention in recent
reference_text:
times, with its extensive redevelopment works in full swing. However, at the heart of it, and often overlooked, sits the Grade II listed signal box on Navigation Street, which houses the centre of all rail operations of the station.

The corrugated concrete Brutalist structure may polarise public opinion, but is actually home of one of the city's most vital and intense infrastructure systems, serving the busiest rail interchange in the UK.

Designed by Bicknell & Hamilton and W.R. Healey and completed in 1965, the unapologetically bunker-like structure is an honest expression of its utilitarian function. Standing five storeys high above track level, the building gives no clue of the hive of activity that exists within its four walls.

The technology inside is of the same era as the exterior façade and was revolutionary for its time. The Relay Room sits just above street level and houses enormous banks of algorithmic electronic relays, known as Wesp

weeks - with Manchester's busiest route now fully branded with an eye to the redevelopment of the iconic building.

The iconic building was given the brand name in 1997 and is one of the most recognisable landmarks in the city.

A series of plans are currently being worked on by SSE and could be unveiled for public consultation in the next few months.

It will be operated from 1am to 10pm each week, including holidays, and open from late May until August 2013.

Biography [ edit ]

Starting out on eSTRO, PuMa was traded to Hite Sparkyz for the beginning of 2010 after struggling to make it into eSTRO's A-team Terran line. He made his Sparkyz debut on the 10th of February 2010 in the Winner's League and in only his second lineup appearance, he performed an All-Kill against Air Force ACE.

Wings of Liberty [ edit ]

Since joining Team SCV Life, PuMa has been unable to breakthrough in the GSL qualifiers, having yet to appear in any regular season. He made his SC2 televised debut in GSTL March. PuMa has since been a significant player in the team leagues for TSL.

On July 20, 2011 it was announced PuMa had left TSL and was planning to join Team Evil Geniuses.[2]

prefix_text: The sport's incredible popularity has turned players into national celebrities and has made their mental and physical deterioration front-page news. In 2012, the former All-Pro linebacker Junior Seau killed himself. The
reference_text:
autopsy confirmed that he had chronic traumatic encephalopathy, or C.T.E., the cause of the dementia that is increasingly prevalent among former players. A whole new crop of retired stars, including Tony Dorsett and Brett Favre, are just beginning to report symptoms like memory loss and depression.

There are two basic rationalizations for fans like myself. The first is that the N.F.L. is working hard to make the game safer, which is flimsy at best. The league spent years denying that the game was causing neurological damage. Now that the medical evidence is incontrovertible, it has sought to reduce high-speed collisions, fining defenders for helmet-to-helmet hits and other flagrantly violent play. Its most significant response has been to offer $765 million to settle a class-action lawsuit brought by more than 4,500 former players, but a judge recently blocked the settlement. It simply wasn't enough money.

generated_result.0:
New York Daily News reports that he was contemplating suicide at the time.

The NFL does not track concussions among players. NFL spokesperson Greg Aiello confirmed the number of concussions per season for the three-team league in 2012 was 19, according to the Daily News. The numbers for 2013 were unavailable.

"It does show the need to keep players safe and make sure that no player is ever taken out of the game," Aiello said via email.

According to the Daily News, the league would not specify the number of concussions the league has seen among players, but it would not have much to say to the team.

"The league is not going to discuss specific cases because they are the responsibility of the individual team," Aiello said. "It is clear that the players who are facing the most significant issues and are making the greatest effort to take care of those issues are also the ones who face the most severe impact of injury."
